meanings.definition: Roughness or harshness in texture or appearance
meanings.sent1: The scabrousnesses of the old tree bark made it difficult to touch.
meanings.sent2: The scabrousnesses of the sandpaper smoothed out the rough edges of the wood.
meanings.sent3: The scabrousnesses of the cat's tongue felt like sandpaper against my skin.
meanings.sent4: The scabrousnesses of the mountain path made the hike treacherous.
meanings.sent5: The scabrousnesses of the rock surface scraped against my palms as I climbed.

meanings.definition: Difficulty or complexity in understanding or dealing with
meanings.sent1: The scabrousnesses of the math problem left the students puzzled.
meanings.sent2: The scabrousnesses of the new software made it challenging to use.
meanings.sent3: The scabrousnesses of the maze had the participants scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: The scabrousnesses of the legal jargon confused even the experienced lawyers.
meanings.sent5: The scabrousnesses of the foreign language made it hard to communicate.

meanings.definition: Immorality or indecency in behavior or language
meanings.sent1: The scabrousnesses of the gossip spreading around the office were unsettling.
meanings.sent2: The scabrousnesses of the comedian's jokes offended some audience members.
meanings.sent3: The scabrousnesses of the TV show's content raised eyebrows among parents.
meanings.sent4: The scabrousnesses of the politician's remarks caused a public outcry.
meanings.sent5: The scabrousnesses of the graffiti on the wall were inappropriate for a public space.
